data.title: Top 5 things to do this weekend in Fort Myers: '80s tribute The Molly Ringwalds, anime fest
data.meta_description: Here are five fun things to do this weekend and beyond, including the annual SWFL Anime-Fest and '80s tribute band The Molly Ringwalds.
data.text:
Looking for some entertainment in Southwest Florida?

Here are five fun things to do this weekend and beyond, including the annual SWFL Anime-Fest and '80s tribute band The Molly Ringwalds.

Plus we look at what's ahead in the coming weeks: Broadway Palm murder mystery "The Mousetrap," the celebrity wrestlers of the WWE SuperShow and more.

To submit events, email the details to reporter Charles Runnells at crunnells@gannett.com.

1. SWFL Anime-Fest in Fort Myers

The third-annual convention celebrates anime, manga and pop culture with celebrity guests, vendors, trivia, a cosplay contest, a lip-sync battle, panel discussions and more. This year's celebrity lineup features anime voice actors Phil Parsons ("Dragonball Z," "Tokyo Ghoul," "Attack on Titan") and Aaron Roberts ( "My Hero Academia," "Tokyo Ghoul," "One Piece"). 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Sunday, Aug. 11. $20. Free admission for ages 10 and younger (with an accompanying adult). Doubletree by Hilton Fort Myers at Bell Tower Shops, 13051 Bell Tower Drive, south Fort Myers. swflanimefest.com

2. '80s tribute The Molly Ringwalds at Caloosa Sound

The Sheffield, England, band plays Beastie Boys, Prince, Bon Jovi and more hits from the '80s — plus costumes, theatricality and a light show. Concertgoers are encouraged to wear their favorite ‘80s gear. 7 p.m. Friday, Aug. 9. $29-$54. VIP high-top tables available for $200-$278 and seat four people. Caloosa Sound Amphitheater in Centennial Park, 2000 W. First St., downtown Fort Myers. CaloosaSoundAmp.com

3. Broadway Palm's 'Mary Poppins'

Last chance to see this classic musical about a magical flying nanny. The stage version of the movie classic is filled with cherished songs such as “A Spoonful of Sugar” and “Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious.” Now through Saturday, August 10. $25-$80. Broadway Palm dinner theater, 1380 Colonial Blvd., Fort Myers. 278-4422 or broadwaypalm.com

4. Fringe Fort Myers fundraiser show: 'Southern Gothic Novel'

Fringe-festival regular Frank Blocker performs his one-man comedy to raise money for Fringe Fort Myers, the annual event featuring comedians, dancers, theatrical acts and more. The actor's decision came after Gov. Ron DeSantis cited "sexualized" fringe fests as the reason why he slashed arts grants for all Florida arts groups this year. Blocker says only a fraction of fringe offerings include adult material, however, and the events are usually big economy boosters in their respective cities. In "Southern Gothic Novel," Blocker plays 17 residents in the small town of Aberdeen, Mississippi. He wrote the show, which he describes as “a cinematic novel in the form of a play done by one person." 7:30 p.m. Friday, Aug 9. $15-$30. Alliance for the Arts, 10091 McGregor Blvd. Fort Myers. 939-2787 or artinlee.org

5. Ivan Cornejo at Hertz Arena

The teen Mexican-American singer-songwriter incorporates electric guitars, dark emo-style lyrics and an alt-rock edge in his Regional Mexican Music sound. His hits include "Reloj," "Baby Please," "Donde Estas" and "Hasta La Muerte." 8 p.m. Thursday, Aug. 15. $38-$185. Parking on site is $30 plus taxes and fees. Parking off-site is free at next-door Miromar Outlets. Hertz Arena, 11000 Everblades Parkway, Estero. 948-7825 or hertzarena.com

MORE THINGS TO DO

Cholo Goth Night at Nice Guys Pizza

Mr. Chino of California electronic-music group Prayers spins an eclectic mix of tunes at this event inspired by the Cholo Goth subculture the band helped pioneer. He'll play everything from '90s gangster rap to underground goth music. The Cholo Goth movement "celebrates outcast minorities and unity through music and dance," according to Mr. Chino. The show also features vendors and a live concert with Dead Meat, the "industrial war electronics project" by Algiers bassist Ryan Mahan featuring elements of punk, techno, "mutant doom dub," "spectral cold wave" and other musical genres. 9 p.m. Saturday, Aug. 10. Free. Nice Guys Pizza, 1334 Cape Coral Parkway E., downtown Cape Coral. 549-7542 or facebook.com/NiceGuysPizza

The Magic of Motown at B.B. Mann

A group of powerful singers and a six-piece band perform hits from The Temptations, The Jackson Five, The Supremes, The Four Tops, Aretha Franklin, Smokey Robinson and more. 7:30 p.m. Saturday, Aug. 10. $44-$86. Barbara B. Mann Performing Arts Hall, 13350 FSW Parkway, south Fort Myers. 481-4849 or bbmannpah.com

LOOKING AHEAD

Agatha Christie murder mystery 'The Mousetrap'

Agatha Christie’s classic, edge-of-your-seat whodunit is the world’s longest-running play. Seven strangers find themselves stranded in a remote country guesthouse during a snow storm — and one of them is a murderer. Aug. 16-Sept. 21. $60-$85. Broadway Palm dinner theater, 1380 Colonial Blvd., Fort Myers. 278-4422 or broadwaypalm.com

Community Day at IMAG History & Science Center

Get half-off normal admission at this annual IMAG event. Activities include children’s crafts, animal shows, science shows, hurricane-preparedness seminars with NBC2 meteorologists and more. 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Saturday, Aug. 17. Half-price admission is $9.75 for adults, $7.50 for college students and children ages 3-18 (free for younger). IMAG History & Science Center, 2000 Cranford Avenue, downtown Fort Myers. 243-0043 or theimag.org

ACMA Bob Dylan tribute show in Fort Myers

Performers from the Americana Community Music Association take on the songs of Bob Dylan in this fundraiser for ACMA's home, All Faiths Unitarian Church. Prizes will be handed out for best Bob Dylan look-alike and the performer who plays the most recent Dylan song. 7 p.m. Saturday, Aug. 17. Doors open at 6:30 p.m. $10. The Americana Community Music Association Listening Room inside All Faiths Unitarian Church, 2756 McGregor Blvd., Fort Myers. americanacma.org

The Modern Bridal Expo Southwest Florida

The wedding extravaganza returns with a 2:30 p.m. fashion show, more than 40 vendors, entertainment, catering and cake samples, and more. 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. Saturday, Aug. 17. Admission is $5 online, $10 at the door. The Club at Grandézza, 11481 Grande Oak Blvd., Estero. southerneventproductionsfl.com

Ben Allen Band fundraiser for Cape Coral Animal Shelter

Popular Southwest Florida country act Ben Allen Band plays to raise money for the Cape Coral Animal Shelter. The night also includes raffles, prizes, a pet-adoption drive and the restaurant's full menu and bar. 7-10 p.m. Saturday, Aug. 17. $20. Nauti Parrot Oasis, 17200 S. Tamiami Trail, south Fort Myers. https://tinyurl.com/3x7r7823

WWE SuperShow at Hertz Arena

The WWE's summer tour returns to Hertz Arena with some of its top wrestling stars, including Randy Orton, Kevin Owens, The Bloodline, Sami Zayn, a championship match between Cody Rhodes and AJ Styles and a triple-threat match with Seth Rollins, Gunther and Damian Priest. 7 p.m. Sunday, Aug. 18. $30-$215. Parking on site is $30 plus taxes and fees. Parking off-site is free at next-door Miromar Outlets. Hertz Arena, 11000 Everblades Parkway, Estero. 948-7825 or hertzarena.com

Lovegrove reopens Matlacha art gallery: Fort Myers space coming soon

Charles Runnells is an arts and entertainment reporter for The News-Press and the Naples Daily News. To reach him, call 239-335-0368 (for tickets to shows, call the venue) or email him at crunnells@gannett.com.
